_header: Saint Andrew the apostle was Saint Peters brother
Subjects: saints’ lives; Andrew, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Andrew in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
Seynt Andreu þe apostel was seynt Peters broþerOur lord
                    sulf to cristendom him broȝte & non oþer…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we seynt Andreu þat he ous so wisse& bidde
                    uor ous þat we come to heuene blisse
BodAsh43.Editions:
Whatley,  Gordon E.,
                        ed.  
             Saints’ Lives in Middle English Collections.
         With Anne B. Thompson and Robert K. Upchurch. MI: Western Michigan
            University for TEAMS, 2004.

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint Andrew þe apostle was seint petres broþiroure lord
                    hem brouȝt to cristindom hym & none oþir…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we ȝerne seint andreuȝ þat he vs so
                    wisseþAnd praye for vs þat we mote come to heuene
                    blisse

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seint Andreu þe Apostel was seint Petres broþurVr lord
                    him self to cristendom hem brouhte and non oþur…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we ȝerne seynt Andreuh þat he us here so
                    wisseAnd bidde for vs þat we mote come to heuene blisse.
                    Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Andreu þapostle Was seint peters brotheroure lord him
                    self to cristendom him brouȝt & non oþer…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Nou bidde we seint Andreu þat here he vs so wisseAnd
                    bidde for vs þat we mote come to heuene blisse
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Saynt Andrew þe apostle was sayn petre broþerÞai
                    were called to cristendome with god & with noþerffor bothe wore
                    þai fishers & als þai fished adayBe þe see our lorde
                    come & til þaim gon þai say…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Nowe pray we to saynt Andreu þat he vs lere & wysAnd
                    pray for vs þat we may comme vnto heuen blis

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Andrew þe apostle was Seint Peteres broþerOure lord
                    him sulf to cristendom him broȝt & bob oþer…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we Seint Andrew þat he her so vs wisseÞat
                    we mote at oure ending come to heuene blisse

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint andru þe apostel was seint petris broþerOure lord
                    hym sulfe to cristendom hen turnde & non oþer…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…bydde we god & seint andru þat he ous here so
                    wysse& bydde for ous þat we motyn come to heuene
                    blysse

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint andreu þe apostel was seint peteris broþerour lord him sulf to cristendom hom broȝte & non oþer…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …nou bidde we ȝerne seint andreu þat he ous here so wisse& bidde for ous þat we mote come to heuen blisse
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxxxvi” added to left margin by later hand (f. 202v).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seint Andreu þe apostel was seinte petrus broþerOure lord him self to cristendom hem turnide & non oþer…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Bide we god and seint andreu þat he vs her so wisseAnd bidde for vs þat we moten comen to heuene blisse
BLEge1993.Note: Ends “Amen” at end of last line (f. 44v).

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEint andreu þe apostel was seint petir is broþerOure louird hom broȝte to cristindom & non oþer…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Nou bidde we ȝerne Seint Andreu þat he ous so wisseAnd bidde uor ous þat we mote come to heuene blisse

BLEge2891.First Lines: SEint Andreu þe apostel was seinte peters broþerOure louerd him sulf to cristendom han broȝte & non oþer…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …ffram ferre londe icham icome to speke in priuetewiþ þe of my soule neode ȝif þou wost schriue me…
BLEge2891.Note: Ends imperfectly due to loss or confusion of folios; fol. 192r-v part of a female saint’s life.

BLHar2277.First Lines: SEint Andreu þapostle was seint Peters broþerOure louerd silf to cristendom him brouȝte & non oþer…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Þermide as me ofte mai to liþer þoȝt heo him drouȝÞat neuere a so fair creature him þoȝte he neseȝ…
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_2277.
BLHar2277.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James. 
             Early English Poems and Lives of Saints.
Transactions of the London Philological Society
         1858; Pt. 2, Berlin, 1862: 98-101.
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.543-50.

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt andreu þe apostil was seynt petres broþerVr lord him sulf to Cristendom hom brouht & non oþer…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …Nou bidde we ȝerne Seynt andreu þat he vs so wisseAnd bidde vor vs þat we mote come to heuene blisse

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Andrewe þe apostel was saynt Petres broþerOure lord
                    him self to cristendome him broȝt & non oþer…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we ȝerne saynt Andrewe þat he vs so
                    wisseAnd pray for vs þat we mote come to heuen blisse.
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Andrewe þe apostel was seint Peters broþerOur lord
                    hymself to Cristendome hem brouȝt & non oþer…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now preie we seint Andrewe þat he vs here so
                    wisseÞat we mowe sone after þis lif come to heuene blisse.
                    Amen.
